alert.note: Alert for Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 8:41PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Mariposa, northwestern Madera and eastern Merced Counties through 915 PM PST... At 840 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Bootjack, or 24 miles southwest of Yosemite South Entrance, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Small hail is also possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Mariposa, northwestern Madera and eastern Merced Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling
